PR 356Collection processed by Marybeth Kavanagh (Feb 2018) and Larry Weimer (Dec. 2018)New-York Historical SocietyNew-York Historical Society170 Central Park WestNew York, NY 10024 (212) 873-3400This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-12-30T18:51:57Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
New-York Historical Society
Kurt Boone photographs
Boone, Kurt B.
PR 356
1.5 Linear feet in two folders
2014-2015, 2017 This collection consists of 10 16x20 inch color photographs of subway performers taken by Kurt Boone mostly in 2015 in connection with his Subway Beats project, and two posters advertising a 2017 exhibition of his photos.
Biographical/Historical Note
Kurt Boone was born in Brooklyn, N.Y. in 1959. The New York City-based author, poet, and messenger is known for his work documenting street culture, including graffiti, urban cycling, street photography, skateboarding, subway busking, and spoken word performance.
Arrangement
The photographs are arranged in the container list alphabetically by title, with posters at the end of the list. Purchased photographs are in a separate folder from donated photographs.
Access Restrictions
Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org. Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
Use Restrictions
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to:
Department of Rights and Reproductions The New-York Historical Society 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194 rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org 212-485-9228
Permission to reproduce or quote text from this collection in a publication must be requested from and granted in writing by the Library Director, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194.
Immediate Source of Acquisition Note
The photographs and posters in folder 1 were gifts of Kurt Boone in 2017. The photographs in folder 2 were purchases from the photographer in 2017 (Rosa Teresa) and 2018 (all others in folder 2).
Preferred Citation Note
This collection should be cited as Kurt Boone Photographs, PR 356, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Credit line for donated photographs: Kurt Boone Photography
Scope and Contents Note
This collection consists of ten 16x20" color photographs of subway performers taken by Kurt Boone mostly in 2015 (one was taken in 2014) as part of his "Subway Beats" project. In addition, there are two posters advertising a 2017 exhibition of Boone's photographs, Music in the Tunnels, held at Quimby's Bookstore in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.
The specific photographs in the collection are itemized in the container list below. Titles, dates and locations used in this finding aid are not found on the photographs themselves, but were provided by Kurt Boone in the collection's transactional documents.
Processing Information
The initial collection of six photographs was processed by archivist Marybeth Kavanagh in February 2018. An additional four photographs were acquired during 2018 and these were added to the finding aid by archivist Larry Weimer in December 2018.
Color photographs. Street entertainers -- New York (State) -- New York. Subway stations -- New York (State) -- New York
